programme.title: Road to Glory - Aquatics
programme.desc: The best diving, swimming and water polo stories from throughout Olympic history including Dawn Fraser, Greg Louganis and Michael Phelps.

programme.title: Strangest Moments | Episode 2
programme.desc: In this episode: love in the Cold War, USA versus Russia wrestling epic, the Anderson-Scheiss marathon, fencing subterfuge, and gutsy Keri Strugg.

programme.title: Can an Olympic legend turn around Hout Bay's football team?
programme.desc: Team South Africa Olympic footballing legend Matthew Booth tries to turn around the fortunes of a struggling local football team.

programme.title: ESP-GER - Women's Bronze Medal Match | Football | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Bronze Medal Match Spain v Germany, at Lyon Stadium, Lyon, on 09/08/24. Final score GER 1:0 ESP.

programme.title: Women's Long Jump Heptathlon Group A | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Long Jump Heptathlon Group A took place at Stade de France, France, on 09/08/2024. Sofie Dokter (NED) ranked to first place with a distance of 6.26m. Adrianna Sulek-Schubert (POL) ranked second and Xenia Krizsan (HUN) came third.

programme.title: Women's 10,000m Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 10,000m Final took place at Stade de France, on 09/08/24. Beatrice Chebet (KEN) won Gold with a time of 30:43.25 minutes. Nadia Battocletti (ITA) won Silver and Sifan Hassan (NED) completed the podium.

programme.title: Volpi (ITA) v Harvey (CAN) - Women's Foil Individual Bronze Medal Bout | Fencing | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: Women's Foil Individual Bronze Medal Bout between Eleanor Harvey (CAN) and Alice Volpi (ITA) took place on 28/07/2024 at the Grand Palais Podium Piste. Eleanor Harvey (CAN) won Bronze with a 15:12 victory over Alice Volpi (ITA).

programme.title: Past and Present - Fencing
programme.desc: We challenged fourth generations of fencing equipment manufacturers to test how their sporting garments has evolved.

programme.title: Road to Glory - Athletics - The Sprinters
programme.desc: A journey through the essential stories of the Olympic Games, focusing on the sprints in athletics, including Jesse Owens and Carl Lewis.

programme.title: Women's Javelin Throw Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Javelin Throw Final took place at Stade de France on the 10/08/24. Haruka Kitaguchi (JPN) won the Gold medal, Jo-Ane van Dyk (RSA) won the Silver medal and Nikola Ogrodníkova (CZE) won the Bronze medal.

programme.title: Women's Shot Put Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Shot Put Final took place at the Stade de France, Paris on 09/08/24. The Gold medal was for Yemisi Ogunleye (GER), Maddison-Lee Wesche (NZL) won the Silver medal and Song Jiayuan (CHN) won the Bronze medal.

programme.title: Women's 100m Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 100m Final took place at Stade de France, on 03/08/24. Julien Alfred (LCA) won Gold with a time of 10.72sec, Sha'carri Richardson (USA) took Silver and Melissa Jefferson (USA) completed the podium.

programme.title: Anatomy of: Sport Climbing, Athletics 100m, and Freestyle Wrestling
programme.desc: In a sports science lab, we studied the physiques of sport climber Nathaniel Coleman, sprinter Tori Bowie, and freestyle wrestler J’den Cox to find out what makes them special at their sports

programme.title: Women's Final | Modern Pentathlon | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Modern Pentathlon Women's Final took place at Château de Versailles, Paris on 11/08/24. Michelle Gulyas (HUN) won the Golden medal, Elodie Clouvel (FRA) won the Silver medal and the Bronze medal was for Seungmin Seong (KOR).

programme.title: Women's 10,000m Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 10,000m Final took place at Stade de France, on 09/08/24. Beatrice Chebet (KEN) won Gold with a time of 30:43.25 minutes. Nadia Battocletti (ITA) won Silver and Sifan Hassan (NED) completed the podium.

programme.title: Women's 100m Hurdles Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 100m Hurdles Final took place at Stade de France, on 10/08/24. Masai Russell (USA) won Gold with a time of 12.33 seconds. Cyrena Samba-Mayela (FRA) won Silver and Jasmine Camacho-Quinn completed the podium.

programme.title: Women's 1500m Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 1500m Final took place at Stade de France, on 10/08/24. Faith Kipyegon (KEN) won Gold with an Olympic Record time of 3:51.29 minutes. Jessica Hull (AUS) won Silver and Georgia Bell (GBR) completed the podium.

programme.title: Women's 4x400m Relay Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 4x400m Final took place at Stade de France, on 10/08/24. The United States of America won Gold with a time of 3:15.27, the Netherlands won Silver and Great Britain completed the podium.

programme.title: Strangest Moments | Episode 1
programme.desc: In this episode: a crazy marathon race, the Greg Louganis story, a false start disaster, why everyone loves Derek Redmond, and the forgotten Olympics.

programme.title: Women's Boulder & Lead Finals | Sport Climbing | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Boulder & Lead Finals took place at Le Bourget Climbing Venue, France, on 10/08/2024. Janja Garnbret (SLO) won the Gold with a total of 168.5 points. Brooke Raboutou (USA) won the Silver and Jessica Pilz (AUT) completed the podium.

programme.title: Road to Glory - Athletics - The Marathon
programme.desc: The best moments from the Olympic Games’ ultimate endurance events with stories from Emil Zatopek and Frank Shorter.

programme.title: Women's 1500m Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 1500m Final took place at Stade de France, on 10/08/24. Faith Kipyegon (KEN) won Gold with an Olympic Record time of 3:51.29 minutes. Jessica Hull (AUS) won Silver and Georgia Bell (GBR) completed the podium.

programme.title: Women's 4x400m Relay Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 4x400m Final took place at Stade de France, on 10/08/24. The United States of America won Gold with a time of 3:15.27, the Netherlands won Silver and Great Britain completed the podium.

programme.title: Strangest Moments | Episode 1
programme.desc: In this episode: a crazy marathon race, the Greg Louganis story, a false start disaster, why everyone loves Derek Redmond, and the forgotten Olympics.

programme.title: Women's 200m Breaststroke - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 200m Breastroke was held on 01/08/2024 at Paris La Defense Arena. Kate Douglass (USA) claimed Gold with a time of 02:19.24, Tatjana Smith (RSA) took Silver and Tes Schouten (NED) completed the podium.

programme.title: Women's 4x200m Freestyle Relay - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 4x200m Freestyle Relay was held on 01/08/2024 at Paris La Defense Arena. Australia claimed Gold with an Olympic record time of 07:38.08, United States of America took Silver and China completed the podium.

programme.title: Women's 200m Backstroke - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 200m Backstroke was held at Paris La Defense Arena, on 02/08/2024. Kaylee McKeown (AUS) claimed Gold with a new Olympic Record time of 2:03.73, Regan Smith (USA) took Silver and Kylie Masse (CAN) completed the podium.

programme.title: Women's 71kg | Weightlifting | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Weightlifting Women's 71kg took place at the South Paris Arena 6 on 09/08/24. Olivia Reeves (USA) won the Gold medal, Mari Leivis Sanchez (COL) won the Silver medal and the Bronze medal was for Angie Paola Palacios Dajomes (ECU).

programme.title: Women's -67kg & Men's -80kg Repechages/Finals | Taekwondo | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
This session includes the Women's -67kg & Men's -80kg Repechages/Finals which took place at the Grand Palais on 09/08/24.
The Women's -67Kg was won by Viviana Marton (HUN) with Gold, Aleksandra Perisic (SRB) with Silver and a tie in Bronze by Kristina Teachout (USA) and Sarah Chaari (BEL).
The Men's -80kg was won by Firas Katoussi (TUN) with Gold, Mehran Barkhordari (IRI) with Silver and Bronze for Simone Alessio (ITA) and Edi Hrnic (DEN).

programme.title: Women's -57kg & Men's -68kg Repechages/Finals | Taekwondo | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
This session includes the Women's -57kg & Men's -68kg Repechages/Finals which took place at the Grand Palais on 08/08/24.
The Women's -57Kg was won by Yujin Kim (KOR) with Gold, Nahid Kiyanichandeh (IRI) with Silver and a tie in Bronze by Skylar Park (CAN) and Alizadeh Kimia (BUL).
The Men's -68kg was won by Ulugbek Rashitov (UZB) with Gold, Zaid Kareem (JOR) with Silver and Bronze for Yushuai Liang (CHN) and Edival Pontes (BRA).

programme.title: Men's 100m Breaststroke - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's 100m Breaststroke Race was held on 28/07/2024 at Paris La Defense Arena. Nicolo Martinenghi (ITA) claimed Gold wiht a time of 59.03sec, Adam Peaty (GBR) and Nic Fink (USA) claimed Silver in a dead heat to complete the podium.

programme.title: Women's 100m Butterfly - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 100m Butterfly Race was held on 28/07/2024 at Paris La Defense Arena. Torri Huske (USA) claimed Gold with a time of 55.59sec, Gretchen Walsh (USA) took Sillver and Zhang Yufei (CHN) completed the podium.

programme.title: The Enhamed Enhamed story (extended version)
programme.desc: Enhamed Enhamed grew up blind in Laayoune, Morocco but an incredible sporting journey began when he moved to Spain and started swimming.

programme.title: Australia’s Ian Thorpe (extended)
programme.desc: Ian Thorpe is one of the greatest swimmers ever, but after leaving the sport he had to overcome a dark personal time before inspiring others

programme.title: Women´s Team Bronze Medal Match MEX - NED | Archery | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Bronze Medal Match between Mexico and the Netherlands at Invalides, Paris, on 28/07/24. Team Mexico won Bronze with a victory of 6:2.

programme.title: Archery vs Cricket with Pravin Jadhav and Yuzvendra Chahal | Sports Swap India
programme.desc: How hard is it for a cricketer to pull the bow string? What are the skills that an Olympic archer can transfer to his cricket game?

programme.title: Anatomy of an Archer: The Hidden Strengths of Atanu Das
programme.desc: We took India’s top archer Atanu Das to a sports science labs to uncover the hidden strength of an Olympic archer. With the help of fellow Olympian Lolo Jones, each episode of our sports science original series Anatomy of studies the powers and physiques of an elite athlete to find out what makes them special in their sport.

programme.title: Anatomy of a Skateboarder: How Does Tom Schaar Get Big Air?
programme.desc: We took US skateboarder Tom Schaar to a sports science lab to uncover the physical secrets of the first skateboarder to land a 1080. With the help of Olympian Lolo Jones, each episode of our sports science original series Anatomy of studies the powers and physiques of an elite athlete to find out what makes them special in their sport.

programme.title: Women's Cross-Country | Cycling Mountain Bike | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: Women's Cross-Country Final at Elancourt Hill, Paris, on 28/07/24. Pauline Ferrand Prevot (FRA) claimed the Gold, Haley Batten (USA) the Silver and Jenny Rissveds (SWE) the Bronze.

programme.title: Anatomy of: Cycling BMX, Basketball 3x3, and Surfing
programme.desc: In a sports science lab, we studied the physiques of BMX racer Connor Fields, basketball player Laetitia Guapo, and Surfer Brisa Hennessy to find out what makes them special at their sports.

programme.title: Harmony Wanjiku: nothing can stop you - Kenya / Superbike I By Her Rules
programme.desc: She fell in love with the sport despite the constant reminder that it was only for boys. Having no idea where super biking would take her, her relentless efforts made her become Kenya’s first woman to qualify for the Superbike Championship in South Africa, where she placed second. She admits that the sport has saved her life“I know myself. If it were not for motorbike, I would be into drugs. I say this because I have seen howmy childhood friends turned out.”

programme.title: Backstage Fun | Charlotte Worthington and The Vamps | From The Top
programme.desc: Olympic BMX champion Charlotte Worthington attends a concert by one of her favourite bands, The Vamps. She hangs out backstage with them and shows off her guitar-playing skills.

programme.title: Women's 10m Air Pistol | Shooting | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 10m Air Pistol Final took place at Chateauroux, France, on the 28/07/24. Jin Ye Oh (KOR) won Gold with a total of 243.2 points, Yeji Kim (KOR) won Silver, and Manhu Bhaker (IND) won Bronze.

programme.title: India’s Abhinav Bindra I Legends Live On
programme.desc: A look at the Olympic achievements of India’s first-ever individual gold medallist, Abhinav Bindra, and how he is now helping others fulfil their dreams.

programme.title: India’s Top Pistol Shooter Manu Bakher | Jee Jan Se
programme.desc: Throughout her childhood and teenage years, Manu Bakher switched sports half a dozen times. When she started practicing air pistol shooting, she knew this was the one for her. This is her amazing story.

programme.title: Original Fuel (Film)
programme.desc: In the former Soviet Union, athletes representing young republics have forged their own path to DIY training and Olympic success.

programme.title: Mat 1: Women's -52kg, Men's -66kg Repechages/Semi-Finals/Finals | Judo | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's -52kg and Men's -66kg Finals took place on 28/07/2024 at the Champs-de-Mars Arena. At the Women's -52kg, Diyora Keldiyorova (UZB) claimed the gold, Distria Krasniqi (KOS) took the silver medal, and the two bronze medals were won by Amandine Buchard (FRA) and Larissa Pimenta (BRA). At the Men's -66kg, Hifumi Abe (JPN) won the Gold medal, while Willian Lima (BRA) took the Silver. The Bronze medals were claimed by Denis Vieru (MDA) and Gusman Kyrgyzbayev (KAZ).

programme.title: Original Fuel (Film)
programme.desc: In the former Soviet Union, athletes representing young republics have forged their own path to DIY training and Olympic success.

programme.title: Meet the entourage of Kayla Harrison, Mark McMorris and Toni-Ann Williams
programme.desc: Kayla Harrison (USA) x BFF Marti Malloy; Mark McMorris (CAN) x Physical Therapist; Toni-Ann Williams (JAM) x Cal Gymnastics Team "sisters"

programme.title: The Olympic spirit : Greek gift, the ancient games
programme.desc: The Olympic Series Vol.3, Program 1 : The Olympic spirit : Greek gift, the ancient games.

programme.title: Transform My Meal: France
programme.desc: Four French Olympic athletes meet up with world-class chefs in Paris, La Rochelle and Val d’Isere to learn how to cook haute cuisine at home.

programme.title: Heroes of The Future 2 | Episode 4
programme.desc: In this episode: Belgian fencer Jolien Corteyn, British taekwondo fighter Aaliyah Powell, and German artistic gymnast Daniel Schwed.

programme.title: Women's Kayak (K1) Semi-Final & Final | Canoe Slalom | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Kayak (K1) Semifinal and Final took place at Nautical St - White Water, on 28/07/24. The Australian Jessica Fox won the Gold with a time of 96.08 seconds. Klaudia Zwolinska (POL) won the Silver, and Kimberley Woods (GBR) won the Bronze Medal.

programme.title: Single-minded Tasiadis embraces his new start in Germany
programme.desc: Greek-born slalom canoeist Sideris Tasiadis found the focus and drive to win Olympic silver after embracing his new German surroundings.

programme.title: France’s Tony Estanguet I Legends Live On
programme.desc: A look at the Olympic achievements of France’s three-time gold medallist Tony Estanguet, who is now leading the Paris 2024 team.

programme.title: Women's Street Finals | Skateboarding | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Skateboarding Street Final with Coco Yoshizawa (JPN), Liz Akama (JPN) and Rayssa Leal (BRA) at La Concorde 3, France, on 28/07/24. Coco Yoshizawa (JPN) won Gold with a total score of 272.75. Liz Akama (JPN) won the Silver Medal and Rayssa Leal (BRA) won the Bronze Medal.
